com.amazon.device.ads

Class AdLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • FrameLayout
      • com.amazon.device.ads.AdLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Ad

    public class AdLayout
extends FrameLayout
implements Ad
    An Android view used to retrieve and display Amazon ads. An AdLayout can only load and display one ad at a time, although there is no limitation on the number of AdLayouts you can instantiate.

    All ad placements must be fully visible without scrolling when initially displayed to the user. If an ad placement is embedded with content in a screen, it can scroll with that content and scroll off of the screen as long as it started above the fold.

    Making ad requests to the Amazon Mobile Ad Network requires the INTERNET permission. Additionally we recommend that you include permissions for FINE_LOCATION, COURSE_LOCATION, NETWORK_STATE, and WIFI_STATE. These additional permissions allow Amazon to provide contextual and geo-targeted ads to your users, which may result in higher CPMs. Declare these permissions in your AndroidManifest.xml.

      • AdLayout

        public AdLayout(Context context,
                AttributeSet attrs)
        Constructor that is called when inflating a view from XML. This is called when a view is being constructed from an XML file, supplying attributes that were specified in the XML file. This version uses a default style of 0, so the only attribute values applied are those in the Context's Theme and the given AttributeSet.

        The method onFinishInflate() will be called after all children have been added.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context the view is running in, through which it can access the current theme, resources, etc.
        attrs - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view.

      • AdLayout

        public AdLayout(Context context,
                AttributeSet attrs,
                int defStyle)
        Perform inflation from XML and apply a class-specific base style.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context the view is running in, through which it can access the current theme, resources, etc.
        attrs - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view.
        defStyle - The default style to apply to this view. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource.

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int timeout)
        Sets the timeout value for loading the ad. Loading is started when loadAd(AdTargetingOptions) is called. The default value is the DEFAULT_TIMEOUT static.
        Specified by:
        setTimeout in interface Ad
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout in milliseconds.

      • getAdSize

        public AdSize getAdSize()
        Gets the size of the ad to load. Ad sizes are defined in device independent pixels, Therefore, the actual size of the ad in pixels might vary depending on the resolution of the device. Ads will scale accordingly to accommodate varying device resolutions within your ad view container.
        Returns:
        The current ad size to load. Units are defined in device independent pixels.

      • loadAd

        public boolean loadAd()
        Load a single ad into this AdLayout, with no targeting options Creates a background thread to load a new ad.
        Specified by:
        loadAd in interface Ad
        Returns:
        Returns true if a background thread is created to load a new ad, and returns false if the load ad request is ignored because there is currently a background thread in progress or because the current ad is expanded.
        See Also:
        com.amazon.device.ads.Ad#loadAd(AdTargetingOptions)}

      • loadAd

        public boolean loadAd(AdTargetingOptions options)
        Load a single ad into this AdLayout with ad-level targeting options Creates a background thread to load a new ad based on AdTargetingOptions. When the ad loads successfully AdListener.onAdLoaded(Ad, AdProperties) is called. When the ad fails to load the AdListener.onAdFailedToLoad(Ad, AdError) is called. An ad that is currently loaded will only be cleared if the new Ad.loadAd(AdTargetingOptions) call completes successfully.

        Only one ad can be loading at a time. The Ad.loadAd(AdTargetingOptions) call will return true if a background thread is created to load a new ad, and false if the load ad request is ignored because there is currently a background thread in progress.

        Making ad requests to the Amazon Mobile Ad Network requires the INTERNET permission. Additionally we recommend that you include permissions for FINE_LOCATION, COURSE_LOCATION, NETWORK_STATE, and WIFI_STATE. These additional permissions allow Amazon to provide contextual and geo-targeted ads to your users, which may result in higher CPMs. Declare these permissions in your AndroidManifest.xml.
        Specified by:
        loadAd in interface Ad
        Parameters:
        options - the Ad-level ad targeting options
        Returns:
        Returns true if a background thread is created to load a new ad, and returns false if the load ad request is ignored because there is currently a background thread in progress or because the current ad is expanded.

      • isShowing

        public boolean isShowing()

      • setListener

        public void setListener(AdListener adListener)
        Sets the listener used to track ad life-cycle events. Only one listener can be assigned per Ad instance. Calling setListener a second time would overwrite the existing listener with the new listener.
        Specified by:
        setListener in interface Ad

      • isLoading

        public boolean isLoading()
        Gets whether this Ad is currently loading
        Specified by:
        isLoading in interface Ad
        Returns:
        true if this Ad is currently loading

      • isAdLoading

        public boolean isAdLoading()
        Deprecated. Use isLoading()
        Gets whether this Ad is currently being loaded. AdLayout only supports loading one ad at a time. Use this method to check if a new loadAd(AdTargetingOptions) call can be made.
        Returns:
        true if this Ad is currently being loaded, and false if there is no ad being loaded.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Releases all resources used by an instance. No ads will be shown once this method executes. The parent Activity's onDestroy implementation must include a call to this method if the AdLayout instance was created through code.

      • showAd

        public boolean showAd()
        Show Ad when the ad state is rendered.
        Returns:
        true if the ad is shown to the user

      • enableAutoShow

        public void enableAutoShow()
        When autoShow is enabled, after Ad is rendered, showAd will be called directly.

      • disableAutoShow

        public void disableAutoShow()
        * When autoShow is disabled, showAd has to be called explicitly.
